intro: Distictella guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan distictella, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
